title: Alphard Island
text: Alphard Island () or Meøya is an island long and rising to , lying north of <a href="Shaula%20Island">Shaula Island</a> in the <a href="%C3%98ygarden%20Group">Øygarden Group</a>. It was mapped by Norwegian cartographers from aerial photos taken by the <a href="Lars%20Christensen%20Expedition">Lars Christensen Expedition</a>, 1936–37, and called "Meøya" ("Middle Island"). It was first visited by an <a href="Australian%20National%20Antarctic%20Research%20Expeditions">Australian National Antarctic Research Expeditions</a> party led by <a href="R.%20Dovers">R. Dovers</a> in 1954; the island was renamed by the <a href="Antarctic%20Names%20Committee%20of%20Australia">Antarctic Names Committee of Australia</a> after the star <a href="Alphard">Alphard</a>, which was used for an <a href="astrofix">astrofix</a> in the vicinity.
